At Sat, 21 Mar 2009 22:34:41 -0600,
Eric J. Bowman wrote:
> 
> Erik Hetzner=
 wrote:
> > Deleting a bag of bagels has the same semantics as deleting a b=
agel;
> > it simply doesn=E2=80=99t matter that the bagels are individually=
 addressable
> > as well as being part of a bag.
> > 
> 
> No, throwing a b=
ag of bagels in the trash isn't the same semantic as
> eating a bagel.  If =
DELETE had batch-delete semantics, there wouldn't
> be any need for the BDE=
LETE method.

Who said anything about eating a bagel?

In retrospect I shou=
ldn=E2=80=99t have chosen a culinary metaphor. Instead of
a bag of bagels, =
imagine a resource structured like a set of nesting
dolls, [1] each of whic=
h is individually addressable; and yet, the
semantics of deleting one are i=
dentical - whether or not the doll
contains other dolls is irrelevant.

If =
you don=E2=80=99t accept this, ok. But I have yet to read an argument why
t=
his is wrong, besides an assertion that they have different semantics
- whi=
ch is wrong in the case of nested resources, in my opinion - and
arguments =
about caching, which are irrelevant to the question of
whether or not this =
can be modeled in a RESTful system.

best,
Erik Hetzner

1. http://en.wikip=
edia.org/wiki/Matryoshka_doll Russian
